overview.description: The PMQC System is an advanced automated inspection platform that delivers micron‑level precision for dimensional, angular and surface quality validation. It combines photo‑based measurement, intelligent segmentation, real‑time pass/fail logic, and statistical process control (SPC) integration to give manufacturers instant quality decisions and full audit trail compliance.
key_capabilities: Intelligent image segmentation (85 % manual time reduction)

prerequisites.description: Industrial camera (≥12 MP), high‑speed optics, vibration‑isolated mounting plate.
Operating System: Windows 10/11 or Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8+, .NET 6 SDK or .NET Core 6 runtime.
LAN or Wi‑Fi connectivity to ERP/QMS, firewall rules: TCP 8000‑8001 allowed.
Calibration fixture (micrometer scale) and test part for first‑time set‑up.

installation: Mount the camera on the fixture and connect to power.
Plug the Ethernet cable into the PC and into the network switch.
Run the Install_Batch.exe (or use the silent installer: `Install_Batch.exe /S`).
Follow on‑screen prompts: accept EULA, specify camera IP, set calibration fixture coordinates.
After installation, launch the PMQC desktop client.
first_run: Open Settings > Calibration. Load the calibration fixture and capture 5 reference images.
Run the auto‑tilt correction sub‑routine to compensate for any mounting tilt.
Select a sample component and run a full scan to verify measurement parameters.
Confirm that the real‑time validation logic flags the component correctly.
Generate a test report and verify all data fields populate correctly.
Schedule a daily export to the test ERP database for compliance verification.

details: Specify critical dimensions, tolerances, and acceptable ranges.
Add angular measurement jobs (e.g., Angle J = ± 0.5°).
Enable CAD comparison: load reference CAD file, align via surface matching.
Enable Intelligent Segmentation to let the ML model auto‑detect measurement points.
If automatic detection is unreliable, manually annotate at least 3 guide points to retrain the segmenter.
Pass/Fail threshold set to ± 0.02 mm for dimensional checks.
Define alert escalation: email to supervisor, stop line if cumulative out‑of‑spec > 5 %.
Scan with the camera; system captures image, applies segmentation, computes measurements.
Displays results: Measurement N, Status, Comparison to CAD, timestamp.

validation_process: Real‑time comparison to tolerances occurs immediately after measurement.
If pass, the component proceeds to the next station; if fail, the system writes the component to a non‑conforming bin.
Operator may override a fail status after manual review; system logs a reason code.
reporting: All scans are stored in a structured log with time‑stamp, operator ID, and machine ID.
Generate batch report: File > Export > Batch Report (CSV/JSON/XML).
Dashboard analytics: View quality trends, SPC charts, and out‑of‑spec heat maps.
dashboard_usage: Immediate alerts: pop‑up and email for out‑of‑spec components.
Trend monitoring: click ‘Batch Trends’ to see historical QC metrics over the last 30 days.
Compliance view: export a PDF audit trail with signed attestations.

edge_cases_and_troubleshooting.description: Model fails to detect key measurement points.
resolution: Refresh the segmentation model via Settings > ML > Retrain.
Add manual reference points in the segmentation editor.

edge_cases_and_troubleshooting.description: Measured values drift due to sensor tilt.
symptoms: Consistent offset from expected CAD values
resolution: Re‑mount the camera and perform a new calibration.

edge_cases_and_troubleshooting.description: Long‑term drift after several hours of operation.
resolution: Schedule automatic calibration checks every 4 h.

edge_cases_and_troubleshooting.description: Loss of connectivity to ERP during export.
resolution: Verify switch health, ensure port is active.
Use the background export queue; it will retry automatically.

edge_cases_and_troubleshooting.description: Manual override of a fail status.
resolution: Always enter reason code; system logs justification for audit.
If overrides exceed 10 % of total parts, trigger manager review.

erp_export.description: Real‑time push of inspection data to ERP.

qms_integration.description: Export of audit trail and SPC data to the Quality Management System.
methods: Export CSV via File > Export > QMS Export
Webhooks: POST to QMS webhook URL configured under Settings > Integration > QMS

faq.question: Can the system run in a high‑temperature environment?
faq.answer: Yes. The camera housing is rated to 60 °C and the software supports external temperature sensor input for adaptive lens compensation.

faq.question: What compliance standards does PMQC meet?
faq.answer: ISO 9001:2015, ISO 14224 for equipment, and FDA 21CFR Part 820 audit trail requirements.
